subject: RE: [junit] How does Unit test in a heirarchy works...
msgSnippet: ... If there are methods in Mammel that you don t want to have in Dog, you need to introduce another class between Animal and Mammel, that Dog can directly
messageBody:
Anurag Setia wrote:
> The requirement might need the methods in the parent class to
> be used in child class in which case you cannot remove the
> relationship between the two. For example, if there is one
> class MAMMLE and one class DOG, you cant inherit both from
> ANIMAL coz there would be methods in MAMMEL that DOG requires.

If there are methods in Mammel that you don't want to have in Dog, you need
to introduce another class between Animal and Mammel, that Dog can directly
inherit from.

Cheers, Ilja
